pageContext.description: Two low ridges on tang; centre hole on tang not perforated, though sunk on both sides. Edge much dented.
pageContext.collection: Ashmolean Museum, Oxford,1836, p. 122 No. 32,Given by Sir William Knatchbutt, 1746
pageContext.toSearch: Figsbury Ring (e-bound), Salisbury, Wiltshire Sp4, UK
pageContext.remarks: Described in catalogue: "32 A brass sword found in 1704, when ploughing at Figsbury, in a great circular escarpment about 2 miles from Sarum, on the London Road, broken as it now is by the plough-share. The entrenchment on the Great Roman Causeway from Broughton to Old Sarum."
